column4: can anybody explain how to get the version i want available in synaptic?
doh :)
you'd have to enable a repository that has the older version.
why don't you first explain the problem you're trying to fix
this is the problem http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=479073
when i look in the pool/main/s/samba directory on nl.archive.ubuntu.com, i see plenty of versions, why can't i select one of those?
because they are part of previous versions of ubuntu.
ah, ok, so when i add a gusty rep, i should be able to select the gutsy version of these packages?
from a distributor's point of view, if you allow a mix of versions, you have to allow a mix of dependency, which is the road to hell.
in principle, yes. But please make sure that it's absolutely unavoidable before you go down this path.
maybe you can just update the server in question?
i'm afraid there is no fix yet for this bug, so also no updates
consider  also what VSpike said
have you tried mount -t cifs ?
not yet
i'll give it a try
what package provides mount.cifs?
smbfs
mount.cifs seems to work
so you're happy?
ok, the problem is fixed now, it seems i needed some obscure config option in smb.conf
I'm glad you didn't get yourself into a mixed gutsy-hardy mess
so am i :)
thanks for your help
